column4: BRIEF-360 Security Technology's Share Trade To Halt From May 2 Pending Announcement
column5: * SAYS SHARE TRADE TO HALT FROM MAY 2 PENDING ANNOUNCEMENT RELATED TO SHARE PRIVATE PLACEMENT Source text in Chinese: https://bit.ly/2vSZ3mn Further company coverage: (Reporting by Hong Kong newsroom)

column4: T-Mobile  Sprint finalizing merger terms: sources
column5: U.S. wireless carriers T-Mobile US Inc  and Sprint Corp  are finalizing terms as they seek to sign a merger by Monday that could value Sprint at around $26 billion  people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: Sprint  T-Mobile deal may cast shadow over tower companies
column5: Shares of the U.S.-based telecom tower companies fell as much as 4 percent on Friday after Reuters exclusively reported that T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp could announce a deal as early as next week.

column4: LATAM Airlines crews head back to work after ending strike
column5: SANTIAGO LAN Express  a unit of Chile-based LATAM Airlines  will resume normal flight schedules on Thursday after most of the unionized workers of the unit formally ended an 18-day-old strike  the company said on Saturday.

column4: LATAM Airlines crews head back to work after ending strike
column5: SANTIAGO  April 28 LAN Express  a unit of Chile-based LATAM Airlines  will resume normal flight schedules on Thursday after most of the unionized workers of the unit formally ended an 18-day-old strike  the company said on Saturday.

column4: Russia gives tentative nod to Schlumberger's acquisition of EDC stake
column5: MOSCOW Russia has given preliminary approval to a bid by U.S. oilfield services giant Schlumberger to acquire up to 49 percent of Russia's Eurasia Drilling Co (EDC)  an unexpected decision given a chilling in U.S.-Russian relations.

column4: UPDATE 2-Russia gives tentative nod to Schlumberger's acquisition of EDC stake
column5: MOSCOW  April 28 Russia has given preliminary approval to a bid by U.S. oilfield services giant Schlumberger to acquire up to 49 percent of Russia's Eurasia Drilling Co (EDC)  an unexpected decision given a chilling in U.S.-Russian relations.

column4: Passenger sues Southwest Airlines over fatal engine explosion
column5: NEW YORK A lawsuit against Southwest Airlines Co has been filed by a passenger who was flying on last week's flight 1380  in which an engine exploded and one person was killed.

column4: Sainsbury's  Walmart's Asda to create UK supermarket powerhouse
column5: LONDON Sainsbury's and Walmart's Asda are in talks to create Britain's biggest supermarket group  a combination which would surpass Tesco's grocery market share and be worth up to 15 billion pounds ($20.7 billion).

column4: Sainsbury's and Walmart's Asda in talks about 10 bln stg merger - Sky News
column5: LONDON  April 28 Sainsbury's  Britain's second largest supermarket  and Walmart  the world's biggest retailer  are in advanced talks about a tie-up that would create â€Ža more powerful rival to UK market leader Tesco   Sky News reported on Saturday.

column4: China loads fuel at world's first AP1000 nuclear reactor
column5: BEIJING  April 28 China started loading fuel this week at a Westinghouse-designed AP1000 nuclear reactor - the world's first - in Sanmen  eastern Zhejiang province  as the long-delayed project took a key step towards becoming operational.

column4: U.S. judge blocks Fujifilm  Xerox merger temporarily
column5: Fujifilm Holdings Corp's  merger with U.S. firm Xerox Corp  was temporarily blocked on Friday following a court ruling  handing its activist investors a win after they sued to stop the deal.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. judge blocks Fujifilm  Xerox merger temporarily
column5: April 27 Fujifilm Holdings Corp's merger with U.S. firm Xerox Corp was temporarily blocked on Friday following a court ruling  handing its activist investors a win after they sued to stop the deal.
